comments:
I see the following exception running the test suite. It indicates we're trying to expand a filtered element in the tree. Looks like a timing issue in the test suite where we are expanding a thread but the target has already terminated.


Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Index out of bounds
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3518)
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3457)
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3428)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.error(Widget.java:432)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TreeItem.getItem(TreeItem.java:718)
        at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.model.InternalTreeModelViewer$3.run(InternalTreeModelViewer.java:1084)
        at
org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.preservingSelection(StructuredViewer.java:1333)
        at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.model.InternalTreeModelViewer.replace(InternalTreeModelViewer.java:1073)
        at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.model.TreeModelContentProvider.expand(TreeModelContentProvider.java:159)
        at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.model.TreeModelContentProvider.handleExpand(TreeModelContentProvider.java:141)
        at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.model.ModelContentProvider.updateNodes(ModelContentProvider.java:608)
        at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.model.ModelContentProvider.updateNodes(ModelContentProvider.java:634)
        at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.model.ModelContentProvider.updateNodes(ModelContentProvider.java:634)
        at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.model.ModelContentProvider.updateNodes(ModelContentProvider.java:634)
        at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.model.ModelContentProvider$7.runInUIThread(ModelContentProvider.java:583)
        at org.eclipse.ui.progress.UIJob$1.run(UIJob.java:94)

Fixed in TreeModelContentProvider. It is possible for a delta to request an expand for a filtered element. The content provider did not account for this. In practice I cannot make this happen - but the test suite makes it happen in race conditions (we terminate the target as soon as it suspends - which leaves the filters/deltas in a tranisent state).
verified, the testsuite runs fine now.
